explanation:
To determine whether setup_epoll_to_listen participates in any direct or indirect recursion you must inspect all functions it calls (transitively) to see if any path returns to setup_epoll_to_listen. The needed symbols are:

- setup_epoll_fd: direct callee of setup_epoll_to_listen. Its implementation (and any calls it makes) must be inspected to see whether it can call back into setup_epoll_to_listen (directly or via other functions).

- MHD_DLOG: directly called by setup_epoll_to_listen (for logging) and also called by setup_epoll_fd according to the static call graph. MHD_DLOG (and any functions it calls) must be checked to ensure it does not call setup_epoll_to_listen or any function that leads back to it.

No other transitive callees appear in the provided static call graph (setup_epoll_fd -> MHD_DLOG and MHD_DLOG has no further callees), so inspecting these two symbols and their call targets is sufficient to conclude whether there exists a cycle involving setup_epoll_to_listen under the given graph.
